thread.title: Oscars 2017: Watch Lin-Manuel Miranda, Auli’i Cravalho Perform Moana ’s “How Far I’ll Go”
thread.title_full: Oscars 2017: Watch Lin-Manuel Miranda, Auli’i Cravalho Perform Moana ’s “How Far I’ll Go”

author: Sheldon Pearce
title: Oscars 2017: Watch Lin-Manuel Miranda, Auli’i Cravalho Perform Moana ’s “How Far I’ll Go”
text:
Share on Twitter Open share drawer Oscars 2017: Watch Lin-Manuel Miranda, Auli’i Cravalho Perform Moana ’s “How Far I’ll Go” Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson introduced the performance Photo by Kevin Winter/Getty Images 
Lin-Manuel Miranda and “How Far I’ll Go” singer Auli’i Cravalho performed the Moana song at the Academy Awards tonight. Miranda did a new verse, seemingly penned specifically for the performance. Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson, who voiced the demigod character Maui in the film, introduced them. “How Far I’ll Go” is nominated for the Best Original Song award at this year’s ceremony. 
For more of Pitchfork’s coverage of this year’s Oscars, click here . #Oscars : @LinManuel raps the intro to Auli'i Cravalho's 'How Far I'll Go' from @DisneyMoana . pic.twitter.com/lYugdlQVM8 — Hollywood Reporter (@THR) February 27, 2017 Tags In This Story
